questions.q: Which antidepressant class is considered first-line treatment for major depressive disorder?
questions.explanation: SSRIs are considered first-line due to their favorable side effect profile and efficacy

questions.q: What is the most common psychiatric comorbidity in patients with substance use disorders?
questions.explanation: Depression is the most common psychiatric comorbidity in patients with substance use disorders

questions.q: The following hormones are secreted from the anterior pituitary gland EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: HCG is secreted by the placenta, not the anterior pituitary

questions.q: Ovulation may be indicated by all the following, EXCEPT:
questions.B: Upward shift in the basal temperature
questions.C: Changing of cervical mucous to thick and scanty

questions.q: Which of the following is the primary source of estrogen?
questions.explanation: Granulosa cells are the primary producers of estrogen in the ovaries

questions.q: Gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulates the release of:
Raised FSH levels are found in all of the following conditions EXCEPT:
questions.C: Women on Combined Oral Contraceptive Pills
questions.E: Peri-menopausal women who had hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

questions.q: Estrogen has all of the following actions, EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Estrogen predisposes to thrombosis rather than preventing it

questions.q: Which of the following pubertal events is NOT mediated by gonadal estrogen production?
questions.explanation: Pubertal hair growth is mediated by androgens

questions.q: Which of the following statements regarding Prolactin is true?
questions.A: Prolactin levels decrease shortly after sleep
questions.B: Prolactin levels increase after ingesting high glucose meals

questions.q: Besides infertility, the most common symptom of a luteal phase defect:
What is the third-line therapy for hyperemesis gravidarum?
questions.explanation: Hydrocortisone is used as third-line therapy

questions.q: Which of the following fetal characteristics is determined via vaginal examination?
questions.explanation: Vaginal examination assesses fetal position during labor

questions.q: What is the gold standard investigation for endometriosis?
Which of the following is a complication of polypectomy?
questions.explanation: Complications of polypectomy include hemorrhage and infection

questions.q: Which of the following is a serious complication of breech presentation?
questions.explanation: A breech presentation can cause cord prolapse

questions.q: What is the correct definition of recurrent miscarriage?
questions.A: >2 consecutive pregnancies that end in miscarriage
questions.B: >2 consecutive pregnancies that end in miscarriage or stillbirths
questions.C: >3 consecutive pregnancies that end in miscarriage

questions.q: Which antibiotic should be added in case of endomyometritis?
questions.explanation: Gentamicin is added for deeper uterine muscle infection

questions.q: Which medication is typically administered intra-operatively to aid the delivery of the placenta?
Which of these medications does not act as a contraceptive when given for heavy menstrual bleeding?
questions.explanation: Oral norethisterone needs continuous administration for contraception

questions.q: Which of the following treatments for primary dysmenorrhea works via inhibition of prostaglandin production?
Which of the following is an indication for induction of labor?
questions.explanation: Ruptured membranes increase the risk of chorioamnionitis

questions.q: The following are presumptive skin signs of pregnancy EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Maculopapular rash is associated with infections, not pregnancy

questions.q: The resting pulse in pregnancy is:
questions.explanation: One of the physiological changes we see in pregnancy is increased pulse rate

questions.q: Normally, pregnancy in the 2nd trimester is characterized by all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: The 2nd trimester is characterized by decreased plasma glucose levels

questions.q: All are CORRECT, EXCEPT, pregnancy is associated with:
questions.explanation: Peripheral resistance typically decreases during pregnancy

questions.q: During normal pregnancy: Which is true?
questions.A: Estradiol is the principal circulating estrogen
questions.B: The blood pressure increases in the first and second trimesters
questions.D: In the second half of pregnancy, amniotic fluid is mostly contributed by fetal urine
questions.E: Maternal hydroureters should always be taken as a serious pelvic condition
questions.explanation: Fetal urine makes up a lot of amniotic fluid volume in pregnancy

questions.q: In normal pregnancy, all of the following are true EXCEPT:
questions.E: The presence of less than 300 mg of protein in a 24-hour urine collection is considered normal
questions.explanation: Plasma aldosterone concentration rises in normal pregnancy

questions.q: In normal pregnancy, levels of all of the following hormones increase EXCEPT:
questions.B: Parathyroid hormone (PTH) in the 2nd and 3rd trimesters

questions.q: The increase in blood volume in normal pregnancy is made up of:
Changes in the urinary tract system in pregnancy include:
questions.A: Increase in the glomerular filtration rate (GFR)
questions.C: Marked increase in both GFR and RPF when the patient is supine
questions.D: Increase in the amount of dead space in the urinary tract
